column4: hi folks!  for some reason i dont hear any audio on my t61 laptop  .  already tried restarting alsa-utils.  checked that it wasnt muted.  ideas?
why are you using alsa-utils ?
no idea;  it was the first thing that autocompletd when i tried to restart alsa
ubuntu 10.04 isn't controlled by alsa anymore
i have the one right before that
same deal.
ok how do i get sound
try this : right click the sound icon in the notification tray and click sound preferences.
click the hardware tab
ok done so far
start some music or video playing (something to have sound) and try out the various profils in the dropdown combo box at the bottom
i assume you have one that says : analog stereo duplex ?
yes sir
in the output tab what is the connector option set to ?
analog stereo duplex;  should i just restart it?
i mean restart uubntu?
you didnt answer my question.
in the output tab what is the connector option set to ?
analog headphones
sorry airtonix
try the other options, on my laptop : analog headphones only sends sound the headphone port and not the speakers
right you are;  analog output (not headphones works)
simple fix
